subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit Testing vs Integration Testing
msgSnippet: ... Integration Testing can give you confidence in your objects, but when an integration test fails, which object is the problem? I don t know. When a
messageBody:
>So said Mike Bresnahan on 2003-06-20 --------------------
>> Unit testing gives you confidence in your objects. Integration
>> testing gives you confidence in the interaction between your objects.
>
>Doesn't integration testing give you both confidence in the interaction
>between your objects and confidence in your objects?

Integration Testing can give you confidence in your objects, but when an integration test fails, which object is the problem? I don't know.

When a Programmer Test fails, I know which object is the problem almost immediately almost every time.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
